text:
A short discourse with Robert Krahn about how cloxp was a potential precursor to today’s personal knowledge management systems like roam, logseq,athens etc…
A interesting perspective on personal knowledge, data and computing 
<https://twitter.com/curious_reader/status/1430467089760985088?s=21|https://twitter.com/curious_reader/status/1430467089760985088?s=21>

attachments.fallback: <https://twitter.com/curious_reader|@curious_reader>: <https://twitter.com/robertkrahn|@robertkrahn> Hi Robert! do you Feels with the rise of PKM Tools like <https://twitter.com/RoamResearch|@RoamResearch> your work on cloxp was a bit ahead of the time? Already hinting at the potentential/dream Alan Kay always imagined (the internet of objects)?
attachments.text: <https://twitter.com/robertkrahn|@robertkrahn> Hi Robert! do you Feels with the rise of PKM Tools like <https://twitter.com/RoamResearch|@RoamResearch> your work on cloxp was a bit ahead of the time? Already hinting at the potentential/dream Alan Kay always imagined (the internet of objects)?
